title: SWP No. 039: Deliverance Dane
content: SWP No. 39.2(Fragment of an Examination of [Deliverance Dane] _dane_deliverence )[++ June 29, 1692] [Deliverance Deane] _dane_deliverence  being asked why she and the rest brought in Mr. Deane as afflicting persons, she answered, it was Satan's subtilty, for he told her he would put a sham upon all these things, and make people believe that he did afflict. She said Mrs. Osgood and she gave their consent the devil should bring Mr. Deane's shape to afflict. Being asked again if [Mrs. Osgood] _osgood_mary  and she acted this business, she said yes.This testimony excerpt is printed in, Thomas Hutchinson, The History of the Colony and Province of Massachusetts-Bay (1767) (Cambridge, MA: Harvard University Press, 1936) vol. II, p. 29.

title: SWP No. 040: Mary De Rich
content: SWP No. 40.1(Warrant for the Apprehension of [Mary De Rich, and Officer's Return] _derich_mary  )[May 23, 1692 ] To the Marshall of the County of Essex or his Lawfull Deputy or  Constable in SalemYou are in theyr Majests Names hereby required to apprehend and  forthwith bring before us, [Mary de Rich] _derich_mary  the Wife of [Michaell de Rich] _derich_michall   of Salem farmes Husbandman, whoe stands Charged w'th Sundry  Acts of Witchcraft by hir Comitted lately on the Bodys of [Abigall Williames] _williams_abigail  & [Elizabeth Hubbard] _hubbard_elizabeth  of Salem Village &c. whereby great  hurt & Injury hath bin donne them in order to hir Exemination re-  lateing to the same & hereof you are nott to fayle. Salem. Dat.  May. 23. 1692 .[John Hathorne] _hawthorne_john   [Jonathan. Corwin] _corwil_jonathan   P ord'r of the Govern'r  & Councill I have apprehended the above named person and brought her as above  P'r [*Jos'h Neal] _neale_joseph  Constable ( Essex County Court Archives, Salem -- Witchcraft Vol. 2, no. 105 )

title: SWP No. 041: Ann Dolliver
content: SWP No. 41.1(Warrant for apprehension of [Ann Dolliver, and Officer's Return] _dolliver_ann  )[June 6, 1692]Essex ss. To the Sheriffe of the County of Essex or his deputie  or Constable in Salem or BeverleyYou are in theire Majest's names, hereby required to apprehend  and forthwith bring before us [Ann Dalibar] _dolliver_ann  the wife of [Wm Dalibar] _daliber_william  of  Glocester who stands Charged this day with haveing Committed  sundry acts of Witchcraft on the Bodys of [Mary Warren] _warren_mary  & [susannah Shelden] _sheldon_susannah  to the hurt of theire Bodys in order to her Examination Re-  lateing to the premises faile not Dated Salem June the 6'th 1692P us  [Bartho Gedney] _gidney_bartholomew   [John. Hathorne] _hawthorne_john   [Jonathan. Corwin] _corwil_jonathan   Just'es of the peace (Reverse) In obediance to this warant I have aprehended the person  with in Named and brought her to the plase apoynted in order to her  examination as atest my hand [Peter Osgood] _osgood_peter  constabell for the town of Salem (Reverse) In obediance to this warant I haue aprehended the person with in Named and brought her to the plase apoynted in order to her examinaton as atest my hand Peter Asgood Constabell for the town of Salem  Ann Dalibar [Dalibar] _dolliver_ann  ( Essex County Court Archives, Salem -- Witchcraft Vol. 2, no. 110 )

title: SWP No. 041: Ann Dolliver
content: SWP No. 41.2Examination of [Ann Dolliver] _dolliver_ann ,[June 6, 1692]Mrs. [An Doliver] _dolliver_ann  was examined before Majr [Gedney] _gidney_bartholomew : [Mr. Hawthorne] _hathorn_john  [Mr. Corwin] _corwil_jonathan  June 6: 1692 [Mrs. Doliver] _dolliver_ann : Did you never act witchcraft: answered: not ^ with intent^ to hurt any body with it but you implicitly confess will: you goe on to confess: but she asked where be my accusers I am not willing to accuse myself She owned she had often been out in the woods all night: once she was in a fainting fitt: & could not get #[hom] home other times she would rather ly in ye woods & goe round them come over with ye ugly fellow that kept ye fferry #[man]: her mother also was not pleased with her & she went from home on yt accot some times: but she had not seen any thing that affrighted her: nor spirits as she knew once a negro affrighted her: & she knew not a spirit from a man in ye night for she had heard yt ye devill some time was in ye shape of a man: & some times she went alone to pray: but [susanna Sheldon] _sheldon_susannah  [Mary Wolcot] _walcott_mary  [Mary Warin] _warren_mary  came being cald they fell down: they all afirmd that this was the person yt afflicted them this day: she had other cloaths but it was ye same face: some of them sd there was a little child: yt was just now dead: yt cryed for vengeance: for she had pressed ye breath out of its body: some of them sd she had tryed seven or eight houses: her spectre sd: to afflict but could do it no where else: her spectre then sd: told them she would have kild her father if she could: for: she had more spite at him yn she had: at ye childe: also her spectre sd: yt she knew: where: to find ye devil at any time: if she did goe but to such a ditch: the [letter crossed out] afflicted sd also: yt she had poppits in a secret place that she afflicted with: [Mrs. Dolliver] _dolliver_ann  was asked whether she had not made poppits of waxe: she sd yes she sd one: after ward she ownd two popits & it was because she thought she was bewitched & she had read in a booke: that told her: that that: was ye way to afflict: them yt had afflicted her: she sd she was not very well upon it but her mother: and her brother Jno were ill were ill upon it when she was afflicted as she thought she sd she was much pinched the afflicted persons: then charged her with afflicting them: & they: every one sd they saw her afflict: ye others: sd [Dolliver] _dolliver_ann  was asked: what she had bin doing: this day yt these persons were afflicted: she sd nothing but spinning: she had stuck pins in nothing but her cloaths to dress her & she had stuck a pin to fasten her distafe: ye afflicted told her she had bin some times in [Tho Putnams] _putnam_thomas_jr  window at ye village but she owned it not: also that she had been at goodwife Nurses: but she sd it was but once when she mist her way going round becaus she would not goe over with ye ferry man: but being bid to shake hands with ye afflicted: she did it & they were not hurt The waxe poppits were made about fourteen year agoe: she standen [uncertain] by took notice that once sd [Dollivers] _dolliver_ann  eyes were fixed: ye afflicted sd ye black man was: before her: in ye time of her examination this wasI undr written: being appointed by Authority to take: ye Above written examination doe testify: #[yt this] upon oath taken in Court: yt this is a true copy of ye #[substance] substance of it to ye best of my knowledge.[Simon Willard] _willard_simon (Reverse) [Ann Dollivers] _dolliver_ann  Examination( MS Ch K 1.40, vol. 2, p. 194, Dept. of Rare Books and Manuscripts, Boston Public Library

title: SWP No. 042: Lydia Dustin Died in Prison, March 10, 1693
content: SWP No. 42.1(Warrant for apprehension of [Lydia Dustin] _dustin_lydia , and Officer's Return ) [May 2, 1692]To the Constable of reading You are in theyr Majestyes Names Required to Apprehend and  bring before us [Lydah Dasting] _dustin_lydia  of Reading Widdow in the County of  Middlesex on Munday Next being the Second day of the Month of  May Next Ensueing the date hereof, about Eleven of the Clock in  the forenoone, att the house of [Lev't Nath'll Ingersolls] _ingersoll_nathaniel  in Salem  Village, in Order to hir Examination, relateing to high suspition of  severall acts of Witchcraft done or Comitted by hir upon the Bodys  of [Marÿ Walcott] _walcott_mary  , [Ann. putnam] _putnam_ann_jr  , [Mercÿ Lewis] _lewis_mercy  & [Abigall. Williames] _williams_abigail   all of Salem Village: whereby great hurt [&] da[mbar ]age hath bin  done to the Bodys of Said persons according to Complaint of Capt  Jonathan. Walcott & serg't [Thomas putnam] _putnam_thomas_jr  in behalfe of theyr  Majestys for themselves & severall of theyr Neighbours, and hereof  you are nott to fayle att your perrill. date Salem Aprill. 30'th 1692P us [John Hathorne] _hawthorne_john   [Jonathan. Corwin] _corwil_jonathan  {  Assis'ts (Reverse)  Pursewence to a warant from yrs honrs baring date the 30  of aprill last for the aprihending and bringing of the person of  [Lidea Dasting] _dustin_lydia  in obediance ther to I have brought the said [Lidea Dasting] _dustin_lydia  of Redding to the hous of [Lu't Ingersons] _ingersoll_nathaniel  in Salem viledg  dated in #[May: the:2d] Salem viledg the 2'd day of may 1692 Atest. [*John Parker] _parker_john  of Redding (Reverse)  [L. Dasting] _dustin_lydia  ( Essex County Court Archives, Salem -- Witchcraft Vol. 2, no. 98.) )

title: SWP No. 042: Lydia Dustin Died in Prison, March 10, 1693
content: SWP No. 42.2(Mittimus for [Lydia Dustin] _dustin_lydia , [Sarah Dustin] _dustin_sarah  , [Mary Colson] _colson_mary  , [Elizabeth Colson] _colson_elizabeth  , and [Sarah Cole] _cole_sarah_salem , and Officer's Return )[December 31, 1692]Province of the Massachusetts Bay in New England Mid'x Ss: William and Mary by the Grace of God King and Queen  of England, Scottland, france and Ireland Defend'rs of the faith  &c. to the Sheriffe of the County of Middlesex Greeting Wee Com-  mand you that you have the Body of [Lidia Dastin] _dustin_lydia  of Reading widow  [Sarah Dastin] _dustin_sarah  single-woman [Mary Coulson] _colson_mary  widow [Elizabeth Colson] _colson_elizabeth   single w[obar ]: all of Reading and [Sarah Cole] _cole_sarah_salem  .in the prison of Cambridge under yo'r Custody as tis said & De-  tained, and under safe and sure Conduct together w'th the Cause of  their Caption under what name or names so ever the said [Lidia Dastin] _dustin_lydia  , [Sarah Dastin] _dustin_sarah  , [Mary Coulson] _colson_mary  , [Elizabeth Coulson] _colson_elizabeth  and [Sarah Cole] _cole_sarah_salem  be conveyed in the same before o'r Justices of o'r Court of  Assize and Goal Delivery at Salem in o'r County of Essex in o'r  Provice of the Massachusetts Bay in New England upon Tuesday the  3'd Day of Jan'a next in the fourth year o'r Reigne. To Do and  receive all and every of those things w'ch the justices of o'r Court  shall Consider of in that behalfe. And then and there you have this  Writt Witness [William Stoughton] _stoughton_william  Esq'e in Boston the 31'st of De-  cember in the fourth year of o'r Reigne Annoq'e Dom. 1692[*Jon'a Elatson] _elatson_jonathan  , Cler. ( Suffolk County Court Files, Vol. 32, docket 2700, p. 23. )(Reverse) By Vertue of this Writt I have hear Brought the Bodyes of those  Persons within spesefy'd and Delivered hear att Salem to the under  Sheriffe [illegible] Phillips  Sheriffe for Mid. (Reverse) The Return of Habes Corpus from the Sheriffe of Middlesex  ( Suffolk County Court Files, Vol. 32, docket 2700, p. 23 )

title: SWP No. 043: Sarah Dustin
content: SWP No. 43.1(Warrant for the Apprehension of [Sarah Dustin] _dustin_sarah , and Officer's Return)[May 8, 1692 ]Whereas Complaint hath bin exhibited before us by [mr Thomas Putnam] _putnam_thomas_jr  & mr [Jno putnam Jun'r] _putnam_john_jr  of Salem Village In the behalfe of  theyr Majestys against [Sarah Dastin] _dustin_sarah  of Redding Single Woeman for  high suspition of severall Acts of Witchcraft done or comitted by  hir upon the Bodyes of [Mercy Lewis] _lewis_mercy , [Mary Walcott] _walcott_mary , [Anna putnam] _putnam_ann_jr   & [Abigall Williams] _williams_abigail  all of Salem Village & craved Justice Therefore  you are in theyer Majestyes Names Required forthwith to Appre-  hend the afores'd [Sarah Dastin] _dustin_sarah  of Redding Single Woeman & hir Safely convey unto the house of leu't [Nathaniell Ingersolls] _ingersoll_nathaniel  of Salem  Village upon the Ninth day of this Instant May by Twelve of the  Clock in the foreNoone in order to hir examination #[& hereof  faile n] upon the premises & hereof faille nott att y'or perill Salem.  May 8'th 1692 .To the Constable of Redding   P us [John Hathorne] _hawthorne_john   [Jonathan. Corwin] _corwil_jonathan  {  Assis'ts (Reverse)  In obediance to this warant I have brought the body of [Sarah Dastin] _dustin_sarah  of Redding singal woman to the house of [Leu't Nathanall Ingerson] _ingersoll_nathaniel  of Salem. Villeg the nint of this Instant Maye: 1692 [*John Parker] _parker_john  Constable of Redding ( Essex County Archives Salem -- Witchcraft Vol. 2, no. 99 )

title: SWP No. 044: Rebecca Eames
content: SWP No. 44.1(Examination of [Rebecca Eames] _eames_rebecca  )[August 19, 1692 ][Rebecca: Eames:] _eames_rebecca  examined. before Salem Majestrats: Aug'st  19: 1692 She owned she had bin in the snare a monthe: or 2: and  had bin perswaded to it: 3 monthes: & that the devil: apeared to  her like a colt. very ugly: the first: time: but she would not own:  that she had bin baptized by him. she did not know but that the  devil did perswade her: to renounce god & christ & folow his wicked  wayes & that she did take his Counsell: and that she did afflict [Timo: Swan:] _swan_timothy  she did not know but that the devil might ask: her body  & soul: & she knows not but that she did give him soul & body: after  ward she s'd she did do itt & that she would for sake god & his works:  and the devil promised her: to give her powr: to avenge her selfe   on them that offended her afterward she s'd the devil apeared to her  7 year agoe: & that he had tempted her to ly and had made her to  afflict persons but she could not tell their names that she first  afflicted: Q who came w'th the devil when he made you a witch  A: a ragged girl: they came to gether and they perswaded me to  afflict: & I afflicte mary warin & an other fayr face: it is abo't a  quarter of a year agoe: I did it by sticking of pins. but did you afflict  Swan: yes but I am sorry for it: Q where had you your spear A I  had nothing but an all but was it with yo'r body or spirit you came  to hurt these mayds: A with my spirit: Q but can you ask them  forgivnes: A: I wil fall down on my knees: to ask it: of them: She  would not own: that she signd the devils book when he askd her  body & soul: but he would have had her done it nor. to a burch  Rign: nor nothing: she s'd the devil was in the Shape of a hors  when: he caried her to afflict: but would not own any body went  with her to afflict but the afflicted s'd her son Dan'll went with her:  to afflict:Q did you not say: the Devil babtized yo'r son Daniell. A he told  me so: but: did you not touch the book nor lay yo'r hand on book  nor paper: A I layd my hand on nothing without it was a peice of  board: and did you lay yo'r hand on the board when he bid you. A  yes: [mary Lascy:] _lacey_mary_sr  s'd she had given her son Dan'll to the devil; at  2 years old: & that her aperition told her so: but: she could not  remember it: she was bid to take warin & lasy by the hand & beg  forgivnes & did so: & they forgave her. she s'd if she had given  her son Dan'll to the devil it was in an Angry fitt she did not know  but she might do it nor I do not know he is a wich but I am afrayd  he is: mary lascy saw her son Dan'll stand before her & s'd Dan'll  bid his mother not confess he was a Wich: his mother: did not know  she s'd but: she might se him for she saw a burlling: thing before  her: [Mary lascy] _lacey_mary_sr  s'd she had babtized her: son Dan'll & that she had  bin babtized in five mile Pond: she s'd the reason she feared Dan'll  was a witch: was because he used dredfull bad words when he was  Angry: and bad wishes being asked: the #[s'd her] age of Dan'll:  s'd he was 28 years old: she was told she had bin long a witch: then  if she gave her son to the devil at 2 years old she owned she had  bin discontented since she had bin in league: with the devil: she  knew not but the devil might come once a day: lik a mous: or ratt:  she s'd she knew [Sarah parker] _parker_sarah  but did not know her to be a wich:   but she heard she had bin crosd in love & the devil had come to her  & kisd her(Reverse) who was with you when you afflicted [Swan:] _swan_timothy  A. no body  but my son Dan'll he was there when I came: theether: she would  have Dan'll perswaded to confes: but was told she were: best to per-  wade him becaus she knew him to be a wich: she was askt if she was  at the execution: she was at the hous below: the hill: she saw a few  folk: the woman of the hous had a pin stuck into her foot: but:  she s'd she did not doe it: but how do you afflict: A I Consent to  it: but have you bin a wich 26 years: A no I can remember but 7:  years & have afflicted: about a quarter of a year: but: if you have  bin a wich so long: why did you not afflict before seing you pro-  mised to serv the devil A: others: did not Afflict before: and the  devil: did not require it: but: doth not the devil threaten: #[to  tare] you #[in peices:] if you not do what he ses: A yes he thretens  to tere me in peices but did you use: to goe to meeting on sabath  dayes: yes: but not so often as I should have done: what shape did  the devil Com in when you layd yo'r hand on the board: A. I can-  not tell except it was a mous #[or rat]( Essex County Court Archives, Salem -- Witchcraft Vol. 2, no. 52.)

title: SWP No. 044: Rebecca Eames
content: SWP No. 44.2(Second Examination of [Rebecca Eames] _eames_rebecca  )[August 31, 1692 ]August 31't: 1692  Present [Jn'o Hathorne] _hawthorne_john  [Jona't Corwin] _corwil_jonathan  Esq'r[Rebeca Eames] _eames_rebecca  further acknowledgeth & declareth that she was  baptized aboute three years agoe in five Mile pond and that her  son Daniell was also then baptized by the Divell, and that her son  Daniell hath benne a Wizard aboute thurteene Yeares and that []  Toothaker Widow, and [Abigail faulkner] _faulkner_abigail  are both Witches and that  her son and both them have benne in Company with her in Ando-  ver afflicteing of [Timothy Swan] _swan_timothy  and further Confirmes what she  formerly acknowledged (viz) that she hath benne a wicth this 26  years and that the Divell then appeared to her in the likeness of a black man and she then gave herselfe she sayth soul and body to  the Divell  and promised to sarve & obey him and Keepe his ways  and further declares that she did Then at that tyme signe to a paper  the Divell then had that she would soe doe and sayth she made a   Mark upon said paper with her finger, and the spott or Mark she  made was black, and that she was then in such horror of Conscienc  that she tooke a Rope to hang herselfe and a Razer to cutt her throate  by Reason of her great sin in Committing adultery & by that the  Divell Gained her he promiseing she should not be brought out or  ever discovered.the abovesaid  Confession is the  truth as wittnese my hand  [Rebecka Emes] _eames_rebecca  The mark   of  [Rebecka Emes] _eames_rebecca     Exa 31 August 92 Salem, [Rebecka. Emes.] _eames_rebecca  signed & owned the abovesaid Conffesion to be the  truth before me [*John Higginson] _higginson_john  Justice of peace. 15 Sep't 1692 (Reverse) Wm Rayment ( Essex Institute Collection, no. 29, James Duncan Phillips Library, Peabody Essex Museum, Salem, MA. )

title: SWP No. 044: Rebecca Eames
content: SWP No. 44.3( Statement of [Mary Walcott] _walcott_mary  , [Mary Warren] _warren_mary , and [Ann Putnam, Jr.] _putnam_ann_jr  v.  [Rebecca Eames] _eames_rebecca  )[Sept 15: 1692 ][Mary Walcott] _walcott_mary  affirmed to the grand Inquest: that [Rebecca Eames:] _eames_rebecca   hath afflicted her at the time of her examination this she ownd: Sept 15: 1692 [Mary Warren:] _warren_mary  & [Ann Putnam] _putnam_ann_jr : affirmed that [Rebecca: Eames:] _eames_rebecca  did  afflict [Mary Walcott] _walcott_mary  at the time of her examination: this they owned  Sept 15. 1692.(On Reverse) Sept 15 1692  Affirmation agt. [Rebecca Eames] _eames_rebecca   of }  [Mary Walcott] _walcott_mary   [Mary Warren] _warren_mary   [Ann Putnam] _putnam_ann_jr  {( MS Am 1147.2, Dept. of Rare Books and Manuscripts, Boston Public Library, Boston, MA. )

title: SWP No. 044: Rebecca Eames
content: SWP No. 44.4(Indictment v. [Rebecca Eames] _eames_rebecca  , for Afflicting Timothy Swan)[+ September 15, 1692 ]Essex in the Province of  the Massachusetts Bay  in New England ss/Anno R R's & Reginae Gulielmi & Mariae Angliae &c Quarto Anno'qe  Domini. 1692.The Juriors for our Sov'r. Lord and Lady the King and Queen  doe. present.That. [Rebeckah Eames] _eames_rebecca  Wife of [Robert Eames] _eames_robert  of Box-  ford in the County of Essex. aforesaid In the Yeare afores'd. and  divers other dayes and times as well before as After Certaine detest-  able Arts Called witchcraft & Sorceries Wickedly Mallitiously and  felloniously hath used practised and Exercised at and. in the Towne  of Andivor in the County of Essex afores'd. in upon and against one.  [Timothÿ Swan] _swan_timothy  afores'd. by which said wicked acts the Said [Timothÿ Swan] _swan_timothy  the day and yeare -- afores'd. and divers other dayes and  times both before and after was and Is Tortured aflicted Consumed  Wasted Pined and Tormented and also for Sundry Acts of Witch-  craft by the said [Rebeckah Eames] _eames_rebecca  Comitted and done. before and   Since that time against the peace of our Sov'r. Lord and Lady the  King and Queen theire Crowne and dignity and the forme in the  Stattute In that Case made and provided.(Endorsement) (Reverse) She acknowledged that she aflicted [Timo. Swann.] _swan_timothy   Indictm't agst [Rebecka Eames] _eames_rebecca  for bewitching [Timo Swan] _swan_timothy   Billa Vera( Essex County Court Archives, Salem -- Witchcraft Vol. 2, no. 53. )

title: SWP No. 044: Rebecca Eames
content: SWP No. 44.5(Indictment v. [Rebecca Eames] _eames_rebecca  , for Covenanting)[+ September 15, 1692 ]Essex in the province  of the Massachusetts  Bay in New England ssAno: R R's & Reginae Gulielmi & Mariae Angliae &c quarto Ano'qe  \ Do[mbar ] 1692The Juriors for o'r Sov'r Lord and Ladÿ the King & Queen doe  present That [Rebeckah Eames] _eames_rebecca  Wife of [Robert Eames] _eames_rebecca  of Boxford in  the County afores'd About Twentÿ six years past in the Towne  of Boxford in the County aforesaid Wickedlÿ & felloniously A Cove-  nant with the evill Speritt the Devill did make in & by which Wicked  Covenant Shee the said [Rebeckah Eames] _eames_rebecca  hir Soule & body to the  Devill did give & promised to serve & obeÿ him & Keep his Waÿes,  Contrary to the Stattute Of the first yeare of the Reigne of King  James the First in that Case made & provided And Against the  peace of o'r Soveraigne Lord & Lady the King & Queen their Crowne  & dignity Cogn.(Reverse) Indictm't ag'st [Rebecka Eames] _eames_rebecca  for Covenanting with the  Devil Billa vera Cogn.( Essex County Court Archives, Salem -- Witchcraft Vol. 2, no. 54 )

title: SWP No. 044: Rebecca Eames
content: SWP No. 44.6(Petition of [Rebecca Eames] _eames_rebecca  for Pardon)[December 5, 1692 ]The humble Petition of [Rebecka Eames] _eames_rebecca  unto his Excellencye S'r:  W'm: [Phipps knight] _knight_philip  & Govern'r of their Majestyes Dominions in  America humbly shewethThat wheras your Poor and humble petitioner having been  here closely confined in Salem prison neare four monthes and  likewise Condemned to die for the crime of witchcraft w'ch the  Lord above he knowes I am altogether innocent and ignorant  off as will appeare att the great day of Judgment having had no  Evidences against me but the Spectre Evidences and my owne  confession w'ch the Lord above knowes was altogether false  and untrue I being hurried out of my Senses by the Afflicted  persons. [Abigaill Hobbs] _hobbs_abigail  and [Mary Lacye] _lacey_mary_sr  who both of them  cryed out against me charging me with witchcraft the space of  four dayes mocking of me and spitting in my face saying they  knew me to be an old witch and If I would not confesse it I  should very Spedily be hanged for there was some such as my  selfe gone before and it would not be long before I should fol-  low them w'ch was the Occasion with my owne wicked heart of  my saying what I did say: and the reason of my standing to my  confession att my tryall was: That I know not one word w't  I said when I was upon my Tryall att what the honourd Majes-  tr'ts said to me but only the Name of Queen Mary: But may it  please yo'r Excellencye: when mr Matther and mr Brattle were  here in Salem they disowned w't they before had said against me  and doe still owne and say w't they had sayd against me was  Nothing but the Divells delusions and they knew nothing in  the least measure of any witchcraft by me: your poor and  humble petition'r doe begg and Implore of yo'r Excellencye to  Take it into yo'r Pious and Judicious consideration To Graunt  me A Pardon of my life Not deserving death by man for wich-  craft or any other Sin That my Innocent blood may not be shed  and your poor and humble petitioner shall for ever pray as she is   bound in duty for yo'r health & happinesse in this life and  eternall felicity in the world to come So prayesYour poor and humble petition'r   [*Rebecka: Eames] _eames_rebecca   from Salem prison   Decem the 5th: 1692  ( Salem Selections, Manuscripts and Archives Division, New York Public Library. )

title: SWP No. 044a: Daniell Eames
content: SWP No. 44a.1(Examination of [Daniel Eames] _eames_daniell  )[August 13, 1692 ]13:8:1692 the Exam. of [Danll. Emes] _eames_daniell : [Eliz: Johnson] _johnson_elizabeth_jr  owned her confesion against [Danll. Emes] _eames_daniell  & yt he was wth her 3 nights before she owned it & aflicted phelps Child wth popets puting pins in it & she se him Yesterday in the prison. he fell upon [mary lacy] _lacey_mary_sr  & Ell. Johnson & [Richd: Carier] _carrier_richard  said he saw him aflict you. [mary wolcot] _walcott_mary  afirmed [Emes] _eames_daniell  aflicted her last night at aslots [?] house at andiver & she se him aflict [[#[danll Emes]] _eames_daniell , [Tim Swan] _swan_timothy  & Ingalls child [An- puttman] _putnam_ann_jr  & [mary warren] _warren_mary  afirme ye [Danll. Emes] _eames_daniell  aflicted them severall times - - - ye aflicted all fell downe wn: he came in Q [Danll. Emes.] _eames_daniell  what doo you act your witch craft before us. tell us how long is it sence you first. Began. ye Evidences say you have be[en] a witch  ever since you ran away. A I never went away but wn I went to the southward & stayd a yere & 3 or 4 months. it was in June. about I am 28 yeres old: I have be maried 8 or 9 yeres. I first & formost am arand [arraigned?] [torn] afore ye. honr. I am her before you. in ye presents of Jx [Jesus Christ] yt you would  pray for me yt I may spek ye truth. he yt is ye Gret Judge knows yt I never did ceovnt. wth: ye divel: & doe not know any thing of it I never signed to no book nor never se satan or any of his Instrmnts yt I know of Q her is [mary warren] _warren_mary . yt never saw you personaly, yt afirmes you have aflicted her above a month. Se if you can look upon her: he turned about & 5 fell downe & wth his touch he raised ym --- I did ^drem^ I se [Goody tooaker] _toothaker_mary  & some others who did tempt me: to Signe to Sattan but I resisted. Q. are you certain you ware asleep: A. I was asleep. to be sure [Samll Varnum] _varnum_samuel . afirmes yt [#[Danll Emes] _eames_daniell  told Me yt] he  yt [Eph. Stevens] _stevens_ephraim . told me yt [Danll Emes] _eames_daniell . said yt he followed ye Divell in ye shap of a horse over 5 mile pond. & Bridges [Richd. Carier] _carrier_richard  afirmed yt. [Danll. Emes] _eames_daniell  shap knock him downe:A. as I was once on aprogrese [Jno. Wilson] _wilson_jno  [Jno Lull.] _lull_jno  was going to Salsbury & I went wth ym: & came againe to gether: [Jno. Lull] _lull_jno . came up along wth me till we came againe @ 5 mile pond. I had ben long from home: & was not willing ye man should goe wth me: home:Bridges: saith: ye report yt. he invited this man & cheated him, told ye man that ther was ye divel in ye 5 mile pond: & said he would goe to him, but he rid away home & shut ye door:ye brook by [Samll. bratlebooks] _bratlebooks_samuel  house. when I was alitle boy: my fathr. left me at home & I got abotle of rum & Drank more yn might doe me good.[mary waren] _warren_mary  afirmed that this [danll. Emes] _eames_daniell  afflicted me wn. falkner was Exam. & ther was a young man apered & ye bl man stood upon his shoulder:[mary post] _post_mary  doe you know DE: yes I know him his is my neighbr. did you ever know him to aflict: no - did you know him to be awitch. no. ----- [Goody bridges] _bridges_mary_sr  doe you know him yes doe you know him to be a witch no: -------- [An: Putnam] _putnam_ann_jr  said he was made a witch at a brook:at yt time at ye Brook at ingagmt [engagement] did you make to ye divell:: Bridges: I beleve ther is evidence Enough. yt he said the divill caried him & his pack to ye brook. at yt sabath day: I doe not know but I might say so, but I bely my selfe -------- [Eliz Johnson] _johnson_elizabeth_jr  afirmes yt the young man yt stood before [Emes] _eames_daniell  at ye bl man is [Deane Robinson] _robinson_deane . & [mary lacy] _lacey_mary_sr  said yt young man hurt [mary warren] _warren_mary :: I se him personally. at [ffr deans] _dane_francis_jr  lane & he told me he was awizard & at gate in his shap & a bl cat wth him yt told me yt ^he^ was danll. [Emes] _eames_daniell : & said he would goe along  wth me to aflict folkes(Reverse) EJ: the 3 time was ye nite afore I owned he said he apeared in his shap & I wen with him to aflict child & aflicd wth pinching & prickg wth a speare [Emes] _eames_daniell  pricked wth a pin, it is all true:------------- post said her compa was Sear. Thomas Beadles] _beadles_thomas  in Salem the Body of [Mary Easty] _esty_mary  the wife [Isaac Easty] _esty_isaac_sr  of  Topsfeild to be Examined Relateing to sundry acts of witchcraft by  her Committed yesterday and this present day according to Com-    plaint  aboves'd and hereof you are not to faile Dated Salem May  20th 1692May 20th: 1692   [John: Hathorne.] _hawthorne_john  Assist  p order of the Councill. title: SWP No. 045: Mary Esty Executed, September 22, 1692
content: SWP No. 45.3(Examination of [Mary Esty] _esty_mary  )[April 22, 1692]The Examination of [Mary Eastie] _esty_mary  .At a Court held at Salem village 22. Apr. 1692 By the Wop. [=worshipful] [John Hathorne] _hawthorne_john  & [Jonathan Corwin.] _corwil_jonathan At the bringing in of the the accused severall fell into fits. Doth this woman hurt you? Many mouths were stopt, & several other fits seized them [Abig: Williams] _williams_abigail  said it was [Goody Eastie] _esty_mary  , & she had hurt her, the  like said [Mary Walcot] _walcott_mary  , & [Ann Putman] _putnam_ann_jr  , [John indian] _indian_john  said her saw her  with [Goody Hobbs] _hobbs_abigail  .What do you say, are you guilty? I can say before Christ Jesus, I am free. You see these accuse you. There is a God -- Hath she brought the book to you? Their mouths were stopt. What have you done to these children? I know nothing. How can you say you know nothing, when you see these tor-  mented, & accuse you that you know nothing?Would you have me accuse my self? Yes if you be guilty. How far have you complyed w'th Satan whereby he takes this  advantage ag't you?Sir, I never complyed but prayed against him all my dayes, I  have no complyance with Satan, in this. What would you have  me do?Confess if you be guilty. I will say it, if it was my last time, I am clear of this sin. Of what sin? Of witchcraft. Are you certain this is the woman? Never a one could speak for fits. By and by [Ann Putman] _putnam_ann_jr  said that was the woman, it was like her,  & she told me her name;It is marvailous to me that #[she] you should sometimes think  they are bewitcht, & sometimes not, when severall confess that they  have been guilty of bewitching them.Well Sir would you have me confess that that I never knew? Her hands were clincht together, & then the hands of [Mercy Lewis] _lewis_mercy  was clinchtLook now you hands are open, her hands are open. Is this the woman? They made signes but could not speak, but [Ann Putman] _putnam_ann_jr  after-  wards [Betty Hubbard] _hubbard_elizabeth  cryed out Oh. [Goody Easty] _esty_mary  , [Goody Easty] _esty_mary  you  are the woman, you are the womanPut up her head, for while her head is bowed the necks of these  are broken.What do you say to this? Why God will know. Nay God knows now. I know he dos. What did you think of the actions of others before your sisters  came out, did you think it was Witchcraft?I cannot tell. Why do you not think it is Witchcraft? It is an evil spirit, but wither it be witchcraft I do not know,  Severall said she brought them the Book & then they fell into fits.Salem Village March 24'th. 1691/2 [correct date in April 22, 1692]. [Mr Sam'l parris] _parris_samuel  being desired to take in wrighting the Examina-  tion of [Mary Eastie] _esty_mary  hath delivered itt as aforesaidUpon heareing the aforesaid, and seeing what wee then did see,  togeather with the Charge: of the persons then present Wee  Committed s'd. [Mary Easte] _esty_mary  to theire Majest's Goale[John Hathorne] _hawthorne_john   [Jonathan. Corwin] _corwil_jonathan  {  Assists (Reverse) The Examination of [Mary Eastie] _esty_mary  22. Apr. 1692  ( Essex County Court Archives, Salem -- Witchcraft Vol. 1, no. 281 )

content: SWP No. 45.6(Summons for Witnesses)[September 6, 1692]W'm & Mary by the Grace of God of England Scotland France  & Ireland King & Queen defend'r of the faith &c'a.To the Constable of Topsfield Greeting Wee Command you to Warn & Give Notice unto the Wife of [Abraham Reddington] _reddington_abraham_sr  . title: SWP No. 045: Mary Esty Executed, September 22, 1692
content: SWP No. 45.7(Excuse of [Mary Towne] _towne_mary  )[September 7, 1692] To the Honered Court now Seting in Salem Right honered: the Constabll of Topsfild hath sarved a warent  one me and too of my sons and too of my dafters: to Apere this day  at Salem I humbly baig that your honers will not Impuet any thing  concarning our not coming as Contempt of athority for ware I my  selfe or any of my famely sent for in any capasete of Coming we  would Com but we are in a Straing condicion and most of us can  scars git of of our beads we are so wake and not abell to Reid at all:  as for my dafter [Rebaka] _towne_rebecca  she hath Straing fits somtimes she is knoked  downe of a sodin: #[and that espachaly If hur ant Easty be but named:][*Mary Towne] _towne_mary   Dat the 7th of September 1692  ( Essex County Court Archives, Salem -- Witchcraft Vol 1. no. 287. )

content: SWP No. 45.8(Summons for [Mary Towne] _towne_mary  and [Rebecca Towne] _towne_rebecca  and Officer's Return )[September 8, 1692 ]W'm & Mary by the Grace of God of England Scotland france &  Ireland King & Queen defend'rs of the faithTo [Mary Towne] _towne_mary  widow & [Rebecka Towne] _towne_rebecca  her Daughter Greeting.Wee Comand you all Excuses Set apart to be & appear at the Court of Oyer & Terminer holden at Salem to morrow morning at Eight of the Clock precisely there to Testify the truth to the best of your knowledge on Sever'll Indictments Exhibited against [Mary Easty] _esty_mary  hereof fail not at your utmost perillDated in Salem  Sep'r. 8th. 1692  & in the fourth yeare of Our  Reign  [Stephen Sewall] _sewall_stephen  Cler To the Constable of Topsfield hereof Make return fail not  (Reverse) I have Warned the Widow town and hare dauter to apere  at the corte.acording to time spoken of in the warant as atested. by me [Ephraim Wildes] _wilds_ephraim   contabl of Topsfeld ( Essex County Court Archives, Salem -- Witchcraft Vol. 1, no. 288. )

title: SWP No. 045: Mary Esty Executed, September 22, 1692
content: SWP No. 45.11( [George Herrick] _herrick_george  and [John Putnam, Jr.] _putnam_john_jr  , v. [Mary Esty] _esty_mary  )[May 20, 1692 ]May 20th 1692 . The testimone of [Geo: Herrick] _herrick_george  aged thirty  four or thereaboutes and [John Puttnam Jun'r] _putnam_john_jr  of Salem Village aged  thirty five yeares or there aboutes and saith that beeing att the  house of the above s'd [John Puttnams] _putnam_john_jr  both saw [Mercy Lewis] _lewis_mercy  in a  very Dreadfull and Solemn Condition: So that to our aprehention  shee could not continue long in this world without A mittigation  of thoes Torments wee saw her # [in] which Caused us to Expediate  A hasty dispacth to apprehend [Mary Estick] _esty_mary  in hopes if possable  it might save her Life and Returneing the same night to s'd [John Puttnams] _putnam_john_jr  house aboute middnight wee found the s'd [Mercy Lewis] _lewis_mercy   in A Dreadfull fitt but her Reason was then Returned Againe she   said what have you brought me the winding Sheet [Goodwife Estice] _esty_mary  ,  well I had rather goe into the winding Sheet then Sett my hand to  the Book but affter that her fitts was weaker and weaker but still  Complaining that Shee was very Sick of her Stomake aboute break  of Day She fell a sleep but still Continues Extream sick and was  taken with A Dread fitt Just as wee left her so that wee perceaved  life in her and that was allJurat in Curia   Sep'r. 9th. 92:   #[ [Benj Huchinson] _hutchinson_benjamin  testifieth the same as]  Atest [Geo: Herrick] _herrick_george   [John.putnam.Jun] _putnam_john_jr  (Reverse) [George Herrick] _herrick_george  against [mary Estick] _esty_mary  ( Essex County Court Archives, Salem -- Witchcraft Vol. 1, no. 280 )

Hutchinson] _hutchinson_benjamin  & [Sam: Braybrook] _braybrook_samuel  w'o testify & say that we together  with divers others the 20. May. 1692 between eight & eleven aclock  at night being with [Mercy Lewes] _lewis_mercy  whom we found in a dase as if  death would have quickly followed, & to whom [Eliz: Hubbard] _hubbard_elizabeth  was  brought (said [Mercy] _lewis_mercy  being unable to speak most of the day) to dis-  cover what she could see did afflict said [Mercy] _lewis_mercy , heard & observed  that these two fell into fits by turns, the one being well whilst the  other was ill, & that each of them complained much of [Mary Eastie] _esty_mary  ,  who brought the book to said [Mercy] _lewis_mercy  severall times as we heard her  say in her trances, & vexed & tortured them both by choking &  seemingly breathless fits & other fits, threatning said [Mercy] _lewis_mercy  with  a winding sheet & afterwards with a Coffin if said [Mercy] _lewis_mercy  would not  signe to her book, with abundance more of vexations they both  received from her.(Reverse) [Jonath: Putman] _putterm_jonathan  [James Darlin] _darling_james  &c against [Mary Esty] _esty_mary ( Essex County Court Archives, Salem -- Witchcraft Vol. 1, no. 279 )

content: SWP No. 45.13(Deposition of [Mary Walcott] _walcott_mary  v. [Mary Esty] _esty_mary  )[May 23, 1692 ]The Depoestion of [Mary Walcott] _walcott_mary : who Testifieth and saith on  the 20th of may 1692: about twelve of the clock: I saw the Appari-  tion of [goody: Eastteck] _esty_mary  come and pinch. & choake me: and terri-  fied me much and she told me that she had blinded al our eyes that  ware afflicted only [mersy Lueies] _lewis_mercy  for she said that she had not power  to.doe itt on that day she was cleared: on this 20th Instante of may:  92 about an hour by sun I went to mr John Putnams to see [mersey Lueis:] _lewis_mercy  and their I saw the apparition of the above said [goody Easteck:] _esty_mary   a choaking of mersey Lueis and pressing upon hur breast with her;  hands and I saw hur put a chane aboute her nick and choaked her:  and all the while I was their I saw her hurting of her griveiously: and  she told me that she would kill her this night if she couldSworne Salem Village  May 23rd. 1692   before us [John Hathorne] _hawthorne_john   [Jonathan Corwin] _corwil_jonathan  {  Assists (Reverse) [mary Walcott] _walcott_mary  further testifieth that on 23 may 1692.  [mary Estick] _esty_mary  did most greviously torment me during the time of hir  examination also the day I saw hir or hir Apperanc most greviously  torment [mercy lewes] _lewis_mercy [Eliz Hubbrt] _hubbard_elizabeth  and [ann putnam] _putnam_ann_jr  and I veryly be-  leve in my hart that [mary Estick] _esty_mary  is a most dreadfull wicth and that  she hath very often most dreadfully tormented me and parsons  above named by hir acts of wicthcraft. title: SWP No. 045: Mary Esty Executed, September 22, 1692
content: SWP No. 45.16(Deposition of [Abigail Williams] _williams_abigail  and [Ann Putnam, Jr.] _putnam_ann_jr  v. [Mary Esty] _esty_mary  ,  [John Willard] _williams_john  , and [Mary Witheridge] _witheridge_mary  & Testimony of [Ann Putnam, Jr.] _putnam_ann_jr  v. [Mary Easty] _esty_mary  )[May 23, 1692 ]The Deposistion of [Abigaill williams] _williams_abigail  and [Ann putnam] _putnam_ann_jr  who testifieth  and saith that we both goeing along with goodman Abby and [Sarah Trask] _trask_sarah  the 20th of may 1692 to the house of Constable Jno:  putnam to se [mercy lewes] _lewis_mercy . as we ware in the way we both saw the Apperishtion of [Gooddy Estick] _esty_mary  the very same woman that was sent whom the other day: and also the Apperishtion of [Goody Estick] _esty_mary  tould us both that now she was afflecting of [Mircy lewes] _lewis_mercy  because  she would not clear hir as others did and w'n came to who laye speachless and in a sad condition we saw there the Apperishtions of  [gooddy Estick] _esty_mary  and [Jno. willard] _williams_john  and [mary witheridge] _witheridge_mary  afflecting and   choaking [mircy lewes] _lewis_mercy  in a most dreadfull maner.which did most  greviously affright us and immediatly gooddy Estick did fall upon us  and tortor us allso Redy to choake us to death[Abigail Williams] _williams_abigail  and [An putnam] _putnam_ann_jr  Testified to the truth of the  abous'd EvedenceSalem Village  May the 23d. 1692 Before us  [John Hathorne] _hawthorne_john   [Jonathan. Corwin] _corwil_jonathan  {  Assists[Ann putnam] _putnam_ann_jr  further testifieth that on 23 may 1692: being the  last day of the examination of [mary Estick] _esty_mary  she did most greviously  torment me dureing the time of hir examination also on the same  day I saw [mary Estick] _esty_mary  or hir Apperane most greviously torment and  afflect [mary walcott] _walcott_mary  [mercy lewes] _lewis_mercy  [Eliz Hubburd] _hubbard_elizabeth  and [abigail william] _williams_abigail   and I veryly beleve in my hart that [mary Estick] _esty_mary  is a most dreadfull  wicth and that she hath very often afflected me and the persons af-  fore named by hir acts of wictchraft.[Ann Putnam] _putnam_ann_jr : declared: to the Jury of Inquest: that her above writ-  ten evidence: is the truth upon her oath: Aug'st 4: 1692(Reverse) [Ann Putman] _putnam_ann_jr  &c ver. [Eastick] _esty_mary ( Essex County Court Archives, Salem -- Witchcraft Vol. 1, no. 286. )

title: SWP No. 045: Mary Esty Executed, September 22, 1692
content: SWP No. 45.17(Deposition of [Elizabeth Hubbard] _hubbard_elizabeth  v. [Mary Esty] _esty_mary  , [John Willard] _williams_john  ,  & [Mary Witheridge] _witheridge_mary )August 4, 1692The Deposistion of [Elizabeth Hubburt] _hubbard_elizabeth  who testifieth and saith  I being caryed up to Constable Jno. putnams house on the 20th of may 1692: to se [Mircy lewes] _lewis_mercy  who laid speachless and in a sad   condition: I saw there the apperishtions  of gooddy estick the very  same woman that was sent whom the other day: and [Jno. willard] _williams_john   and [mary witherridge] _witheridge_mary  Afflecting and tortoring of [Mircy lewes] _lewis_mercy  in a  most dreadfull maner.which did affright me most greviously: and  immediatly [gooddy Estick] _esty_mary  did sett upon me most dreadfully and  tortored me almost Ready to choak me to death and urged me  vehemently to writ in hir bookSworne Salem Village  May the 23d: 1692.   Before us  [John Hathorne] _hawthorne_john   [Jonathan. Corwin] _corwil_jonathan  {  Assists. we whose names are under writen heaving been along with [Elizabeth . Huburd] _hubbard_elizabeth  this time above mentioned herd hir declare what is  above writen and we read it to hir when we came away and she  said it was all true this 21 may 1692 [Thomas putnam] _putnam_thomas_jr   [John.putnam Jun] _putnam_john_jr   Jurat in Curia Sept'r. 9th. 1692 [Eliz Hubburd] _hubbard_elizabeth  further testifieth that on the 23 may 1692 being  the last day of the examination of [mary Estick] _esty_mary  she did most greviously  afflect and torment me dureing the time of hir Examination allso  dureing the time of her examination I saw [mary Estick] _esty_mary  most greviously  aflect and torment [mary walcott] _walcott_mary  [mercy lewes] _lewis_mercy  [Abigail williams] _williams_abigail   and [ann putnam] _putnam_ann_jr  by twisting and all most choaking them to death  and I verily beleve in my heart that mary estick is a most dreadfull  wicth and that she hath very often afflected and tormented me and  parsons above named by hir acts of wicthcraft [Eliz. Hubbard] _hubbard_elizabeth  declared the two above written evidences: in this  paper before the Jury of Inquest: to be the truth:upon oath: August 4:1692 (Reverse)[El. Hubbard] _hubbard_elizabeth  Contr. [Easty] _esty_mary  ( Essex County Court Archives, Salem -- Witchcraft Vol. 1 no. 286 )

title: SWP No. 045: Mary Esty Executed, September 22, 1692
content: SWP No. 45.18( Deposition of [Samuel Abby] _abbey_samuel  & Testimony of [Sarah Trask] _trask_sarah  v. [Mary Esty] _esty_mary  , [John Willard] _williams_john  ,  & [Mary Witheridge] _witheridge_mary  )[September 9, 92 ]+May 23, 1692The Deposistion of [Samuell Abby] _abbey_samuel  aged about 45 years who  testifieth and saith that on the 20th of may 1692 I went to the  house. of constable Jno. putnam:about 9 a clock in the moring and  when I came there: [Mircy lewes] _lewis_mercy  lay on the bed in a sad condition and  continewing speachless for about an hour: the man not being at  whom: the woman desired me to goe to [Tho: putnams] _putnam_thomas_jr  to bring [Ann putnam] _putnam_ann_jr  to se if she could se who it was that hurt [mircy lewes:] _lewis_mercy  accordingly  I went: and found [Abigail williams] _williams_abigail  along with [ann putnam] _putnam_ann_jr :  and brought them both to se [mircy lewes:] _lewis_mercy  and as they ware a goeing  along the way both of them said that they saw the Apperishtion of  [Goody Estick] _esty_mary  and said it was the same woman that was sent whom  the other day: and said also that they saw the Apperishtion of the  other woman that appered with goody estick the other day.and both  of them allso said that the Apperishtion of [goody Estick] _esty_mary  tould them  that now she was afflecting of [mircy lewes:] _lewis_mercy  and when they came to  [Mircy lewes] _lewis_mercy  both of them said that they saw the Apperishtion of  [goody Estick] _esty_mary  and [Jno. willard] _williams_john  and [mary witheridge] _witheridge_mary  afflecting the  body of [mircy lewes:] _lewis_mercy  and I continewing along with [mircy] _lewis_mercy  who con-  tinewed in a sad condition the greatest part of the day being in such  tortors as no toungue can express: but not able to spake: but at last  said Deare lord Receive my soule and againe said Lord let them not  kill me quitt, but att last she came to hir self for a little whille and  was very sensable and [and] then she said that [goody estick] _esty_mary  said  she would kill hir before midnight because she did not cleare hir  so as the Rest did. then againe presently she fell very bad and cried  out pray for the salvation of my soule for they will kil meJurat in Curia  Sep'r. 9th. 92  [Sarah Trask] _trask_sarah  ageed about 19 years testifieth that she went along  with [Abigaill williams] _williams_abigail  and #[Mircy Lewis] [Ann putnam] _putnam_ann_jr  and also hard them say what  is above writen they said: and also hard [mircy lewes] _lewis_mercy  declare what is above writen she said. (Reverse) [Sam Abbey] _abbey_samuel  ( Essex County Court Archives, Salem -- Witchcraft Vol 1, no. 290. )

title: SWP No. 045: Mary Esty Executed, September 22, 1692
content: SWP No. 45.19( Deposition of [Edward Putnam] _putnam_edward  v. [Mary Esty] _esty_mary  )[++ September 9, 1692]the deposistion of [Edward Putnam] _putnam_edward  aged abought 38 years ho testifieth and saith abought 18 day of may 1692 [mary easty] _esty_mary  the prisner now at the bar being then seat at liberty but one the 20 and 21 days of may marcy lues was so greviously aflicted and tortred by her (as she her self and [mary walcott] _walcott_mary : [an putnam] _putnam_ann_jr  [Elizabeth hubbart] _hubbard_elizabeth   [abigel williams] _williams_abigail  ) said) I my self being ther present with several others with marcy lues looked for nothing else: but present death with marcy lues for all most the space of two days and a night she was choked allmost to death in so much we thought sumtimes she had banded her mouth and teath shut and all this very often untell shuch time as we under stood [mary easty] _esty_mary  was laid in Irons, allso  apon the second day of mary estys examination at the vilag [marcy lues] _lewis_mercy  [mary walcott] _walcott_mary  [elizabeth hubbart] _hubbard_elizabeth  [ann putnam] _putnam_ann_jr  [mary warrin] _warren_mary  and [abigell williams] _williams_abigail  when [mary easty] _esty_mary  came to the [mar'] haile to go to paryer and in prayer time and sumtime after it they remaned in this sad condition of being all most choked to death and when they ware abul again to speak they all with one Consent charged her that she did them that mischef. I all so have hard sum of them Complain very often of hur hurting them with the spindall of a wheel.Jurat in Curia   [*Edward putnam] _putnam_edward  (Reverse) [Ed'd. Putm'n] _putnam_edward  ( Essex County Court Archives, Salem -- Witchcraft Vol 1 no. 291 )

title: SWP No. 045: Mary Esty Executed, September 22, 1692
content: SWP No. 45.20(Deposition of [Samuel Smith] _smith_samuel  v. [Mary Esty] _esty_mary  )[++ April 22, 1692]The deposistion of [Samuell Smith] _smith_samuel  of Boxford about 25 yers who  testifieth and saith that about five years sence I was one night att   the house of [Isaac Estick sen'r.] _esty_isaac_sr  of Topsfeild and I was as farr as  I know to Rude in discorse and the above said [Esticks wife] _esty_mary  said  to me I would not have you be so rude in discorse for I might Rue it  hereafter and as I was agoeing whom that night about a quarter of  a mille from the said Esticks house by a stone wall I Received a  little blow on my shoulder with I know not what and the stone wall  rattleed very much which affrighted me my horse also was affrighted  very much but I cannot give the reson of it.(Reverse) [Sam'll Smith] _smith_samuel  ag'st. [G. Easty] _esty_mary ( Essex County Court Archives, Salem -- Witchcraft Vol. 1 no. 292 )

title: SWP No. 045: Mary Esty Executed, September 22, 1692
content: SWP No. 45.21( Deposition of [Margaret Reddington] _reddington_margaret  v. [Mary Esty] _esty_mary  )[++April 22, 1692]the depesiasian of [margret Redengton] _reddington_margaret  eged about seventiy  yers testifieth and saith that a bout three yers a gow I was at [good mon Esties] _esty_isaac_sr  and talking with his wife a bout an In fermety I hade  and presantly after I fell Into a most sollom condision and the thres-  day before the thanksgiving that wee hade last. In the afternone I  was exseding elle and that night [godey Estiey] _esty_mary  apered to mee and  profered me a pece of fresh mete and I tolld hare twas not fete for  the doges and I would have non of ite and then she vanished a  waye( Essex County Court Archives, Salem -- Witchcraft Vol. 1 no. 293 )

title: SWP No. 045: Mary Esty Executed, September 22, 1692
content: SWP No. 45.22(Petition of [Mary Esty] _esty_mary  and [Sarah Cloyce] _cloyce_sarah  )[September 9, 1692]The humble Request of [Mary Esty] _esty_mary  and [Sarah Cloys] _cloyce_sarah  to the Honoured  Court.Humbly sheweth, that whereas we two Sisters [Mary Esty] _esty_mary   & [Sarah Cloys] _cloyce_sarah  stand now before the Honoured court charged with the  suspition of Witchcraft, our humble request is first that seing we are  neither able to plead our owne cause, nor is councell alowed to those  in our condicion; that you who are our Judges, would please to be  of councell to us, to direct us wherein we may stand in neede.   Secondly that whereas we are not conscious to ourselves of any  guilt in the least degree of that crime, wherof we are now accused  (in the presence of the Living God we speake it, before whose aw-  full Tribunall we know we shall ere Long appeare) nor of any other  scandalouse evill, or miscaryage inconsistant with Christianity, Those  who have had the Longest and best knowledge of us, being persons  of good report, may be suffered to Testifie upon oath what they  know concerning each of us, viz [Mr. Capen] _capen_joseph  the pastour and those of  the Towne & Church of Topsfield, who are ready to say somthing  which we hope may be looked upon, as very considerable in this  matter; with the seven children of one of us, viz [Mary Esty] _esty_mary  , and it  may be produced of Like nature in reference to the wife of [Peter Cloys] _cloyce_peter  , her sister. Thirdly that the Testimony of witches, or such as  are afflicted, as is supposed, by witches may not be improved to con-  demn us, without other Legal evidence concurring, we hope the  Honoured Court & Jury will be soe tender of the lives of such,  as we are who have for many years Lived under the unblemished  reputation of Christianity, as not to condemne them without a  fayre and equall hearing of what may be sayd for us, as well as  against us. And your poore supplyants shall be bound always to  pray &c.(Reverse) [Easty] _esty_mary  & [Cloyce] _cloyce_sarah  peticon( Essex County Court Archives, Salem -- Witchcraft Vol. 1. no. 295 )

title: SWP No. 045: Mary Esty Executed, September 22, 1692
content: SWP No. 45.23(Petition of [Mary Esty] _esty_mary  )[++ September 15, 1692]The humbl petition of [mary Eastick] _esty_mary  unto his Excellencyes S'r [W'm Phipps] _phipps_william  to the honour'd Judge and Bench now Sitting In Judi-  cature in Salem and the Reverend ministers humbly shewethThat whereas your poor and humble Petiti[obar ][nbar ] being condemned  to die Doe humbly begg of you to take it into your Judicious and  pious considerations that your Poor and humble petitioner knowing  my own Innocencye Blised be the Lord for it and seeing plainly  the wiles and subtility of my accusers by my Selfe can not but  Judg charitably of others that are going the same way of my selfe  if the Lord stepps not mightily in i was confined a whole month   upon the same account that I am condemed now for and then  cleared by the afflicted persons as some of your honours know and  in two dayes time I was cryed out upon by them and have been con-  fined and now am condemned to die the Lord above knows my  Innocencye then and Likewise does now as att the great day will be  known to men and Angells -- I Petition to your honours not for my  own life for I know I must die and my appointed time is sett but the  Lord he knowes it is that if it be possible no more Innocentt blood  may be shed which undoubtidly cannot be Avoydd In the way and  course you goe in I question not but your honours does to the  uttmost of your Powers in the discovery and detecting of witchcraft  and witches and would not be gulty of Innocent blood for the world  but by my own Innocencye I know you are in the wrong way the  Lord in his infinite mercye direct you in this great work if it be his  blessed will that no more Innocent blood be shed I would humbly  begg of you that your honors would be plesed to examine theis  Aflicted Persons strictly and keepe them apart some time and Like-  wise to try some of these confesing wichis I being confident there  is severall of them has belyed themselves and others as will appeare  if not in this wor[l]d I am sure in the world to come whither I am  now agoing and I Question not but youle see an alteration of thes  things they say my selfe and others having made a League with the  Divel we cannot confesse I know and the Lord knowes as will shortly  appeare they belye me and so I Question not but they doe others the  Lord above who is the Searcher of all hearts knowes that as I shall  answer it att the Tribunall seat that I know not the least thinge  of witchcraft therfore I cannot I dare not belye my own soule I  beg your honers not to deny this my humble petition from a poor  dy ing Innocent person and I Question not but the Lord will give  a blesing to yor endevers(Reverse) To his Excellencye S'r [W'm Phipps:] _phipps_william  Govern'r and to the  honoured Judge and Magistrates now setting in Judicature in  Salem.(Reverse) [Mary Easty] _esty_mary  Petition( Essex County Court Archives, Salem -- Witchcraft Vol. 1. no. 294 )

title: SWP No. 046: Esther Elwell
content: SWP No. 46.1(Warrant for apprehension of [Esther Elwell] _elwell_esther  , [Abigail Roe] _roe_abigail  ,  and [Rebecca Dike] _dike_rebecca  )[November 5, 1692 ]To the Sheriffe of Our County of Essex, his under Sheriffe or De-  puty. or Constable of Glocester, or Constable. Whereas Complaint  Is made by [Leut. James Stevens] _stevens_james  & [William Stevens] _stevens_william  & [Nathaniel Coyt] _coyt_nathaniel   all of Glocester, In the County of Essex In behalfe of their Majes-  ties, unto -- thair Majesties Justices. of the peace. against [Esther Ellwell] _elwell_esther  the wife of [Samuel Elwell] _elwell_samuell  , & [Abigail Roe] _roe_abigail  daughter of [Hugh Roe: #[Robta]] _roe_hugh  & [Rebecka Dike] _dike_rebecca  , the wife of [Richard Dike] _dike_richard  . #[both] all of Gloster, af-  foresaid, for that they have Grounded suspicion that the Said [Elwell Dike] _dike_elwell  & [Roe] _roe_abigail  have wickedly & felloniously Comitted Sundry acts of  witchcraft upon the body of [Mrs. Mary fitch] _fitch_mary  the wife of [Mr. John fitch] _fitch_john  of Gloaster afforesaid, unto the Wasteing pineing & Consume-  ing of her body Contrary to the peace of our sovereigne Lord & Lady  the King & Queen & Contrary to the forme of the statutes in that  Case made & Provided. & have Craved Justice & have Entered into  Recognisance, to prosecute the Said Complaint to Effect. the which  is therefore In their Majesties Names. William & Mary of England &c  King & Queen to Require you by vertue hereof forwith or as soon as  may be, to Apprehend Seize & Secure the Said [Esther Ellwell] _elwell_esther  [Re- becka Dike] _dike_rebecca  & [Abigall Roe] _roe_abigail  & them haveing So Secured You are the  first Convenient time to bring before their Majesties Justices of the  Peace for the County of Essex that thay may be Examined & Pro-  vided with as the Law Directs of which You are not to faile at your  Perrill & for So Doeing this shall be Your sufficient Warrant,  & make a true Returne under Your hand according to Law --Ipswich Novemb'r. 5th 1692  Given under my hand  [*Tho's. Wade] _wade_thomas  . J: P. ( Suffolk Court Files vol. 32, docket No. 2689 p. 17 )

title: SWP No. 046: Esther Elwell
content: SWP No. 46.2(Testimony of [James Stevens] _stevens_james  )[November 8, 1692 ][James Stevens] _stevens_james  testifieth and saith that [Mary Fitch] _fitch_mary  did say that she  felt A woman upon the bed, and put forth hir hand, and felt the  hair and felt the hair of hir head and A peg in it, also testifieth  that she said she was squesed to pieces, whereas I saw no body  hurt hur.Ipswich Nov'br: the 8th 1692  sworne  before us,  [*Daniell Epps] _epes_daniel  , J: P:  [Tho's. Wade:] _wade_thomas  J: P: ( Suffolk Court Files Vol. 32, docket No. 2689 p. 17 )

title: SWP No. 046: Esther Elwell
content: SWP No. 46.3([Elizabeth Hubbard] _hubbard_elizabeth  v. [Abigail Row] _roe_abigail , [Esher Elwell] _elwell_esther , [Rebecca Diks] _dike_rebecca  )[November 9, 1692 ]The Deposition of [Elizabeth Hubburd] _hubbard_elizabeth  aged Seventeen years saith: that she saw [Abigall Row] _roe_abigail  [Ester Elwell] _elwell_esther  & [Rebecca Dike] _dike_rebecca  ^or three in ther likeness^ o pressing Squezeing & choaking of [mary ffitch] _fitch_mary  the wife of [John ffitch] _fitch_john : which was done on thirsday the third of November ^1692^ and at Severall other times, & ye ^last^ night that. Night she said, [ffitch] _fitch_mary  did she saw one on one side & another- on ye other side & one at her back. [unclear] 9br ye 8th 1692. affirmed before us  [Daniell Epps] _epes_daniel , J:P [Thos. Wade] _wade_thomas . J:P.(Reverse) [Elizabeth: Hubard] _hubbard_elizabeth  being asked whither she thought that ye persons within named was ye Cause of ye death- of [Mary fitch] _fitch_mary  she said she could not tell what to think about it.Documents in MISC. MS. in the Massachusetts Historical Society, Boston, MA.

title: SWP No. 047: Martha Emerson
content: SWP No. 47.1(Warrant for apprehension of [Martha Emerson, and Officer's Return] _emerson_martha  )[July 22, 1692 ] To the Sherriff of the County of Essex or his Dept or Constable of  HaverhillYou are in theire Majest's names hereby required forthwith or as  soon as may be to Bring before us [Martha Emerson] _emerson_martha  /the wife of  [Joseph Emerson] _emerson_joseph  of Haverhill, who was Daughter of [Roger toothak[e]r] _toothaker_roger   of Belrica late Deceased; who stands accused of haveing committed  sundry acts of Witchcraft Lately on the Bodys of [Mary Warren] _warren_mary  [Mary Lacy] _lewis_mercy  & others to theire graete hurtes. And that in  Order to her Examination Relateing to the abovesaid Premisses  and hereof faile not Dated Salem July the 22th 1692 , You are like-  wise required to make diligent search for any Images or Popetts  &c in s'd house or aboute itt --Salem:   [Bartho. Gedney] _gidney_bartholomew   [John Hathorne] _hawthorne_john   [Jonathan. Corwin] _corwil_jonathan   [John Higginson] _higginson_john  {  Justices Peace by virtue of the of this warant I have Seased [Martha Emerson] _emerson_martha  of  haverhill and have brought her here to answer to what shall be  Charged Against her Dat this 22 of July 1692 Per me [*William Starling] _starling_william   Constable ( MS Ch K 1.40, vol. 2, p. 28, Rare Books & Manuscripts, Boston Public Library, Boston, MA.)

title: SWP No. 047: Martha Emerson
content: SWP No. 47.2(Examination of [Martha Emerson] _emerson_martha  )[July 23, 1692 ][Martha Emorson] _emerson_martha  was examined before [Maj'r Gedney] _gidney_bartholomew  & other their  Majest'es Justices in Salem July 23: 1692 .[Martha Emorson] _emerson_martha  you are here accused for afflicting: of [Mary Warin] _warren_mary   & [Mary Lasey:] _lacey_mary_sr  by witchcraft: what say you: Answer: I never saw  them. [Richard Carrier:] _carrier_richard  s'd he see her hurt them both yester day,  but he had never seen her at the witch meeting: but [Mary lasey] _lacey_mary_sr   sen'r s'd that she had seen both [Martha Emorson] _emerson_martha  & her mother at  the witch meeting. [Mary Warin] _warren_mary  & [Mary Lacy] _lacey_mary_sr  fell down when s'd  [Martha Emorson] _emerson_martha  looked on them: & [Mary Lasy] _lacey_mary_sr  was presently well  when s'd [Emorson] _emerson_martha  took her by the wrist: two more also fell down  with her looking on them: but: she denyed that she knew anything  of witchcraft.[Mary Warin] _warren_mary  s'd: that s'd [Emersons] _emerson_martha  spectre told her: that: she had rid  a man with an inchanted bridle: & [Matthew Herriman:] _herriman_matthew  was called:  to say whether he had bin ridden: so or no: who answered. that last  Monday night: he was in a strange condision: and heard it rain  & blow: as I thought: but in the morning there had bin no rain: but  in the morning my tongue was sore & I could not speak till son two  hours high: & [Martha Emorson] _emerson_martha  came to our house that morning: as  soon as it was light for fire: [Mary: Warin] _warren_mary  being in a long Dumb fitt;  signified by holding up her hand that this [Harriman] _herriman_matthew  was the man  that she s'd [Emorson] _emerson_martha  s'd she had ridden: but [Emorson] _emerson_martha  s'd she knew  nothing of it [Emerson] _emerson_martha  was told: that her father: had s'd: he had  tought his Daughter Martha so that she had killed a witch: and:  that was to take the afflicted persons water & put in in a glass or  bottle: & sett it into an oven: [Emorson] _emerson_martha  owned she had [kept] a  womans urin: in a glass. [Emorson] _emerson_martha  was asked: who hindred her  from confessing she answered that her [Aunt Carrier] _carrier_martha  & [good wife Green] _green_mary  of Haverill: were before her: [good wife Green:] _green_mary  was angry  with her: because she would not be like her selfe for [Green] _green_mary  had  Inticed her a fortnight: to afflict & she would not: she s'd [Greens wife] _green_mary  would have her be of: that number: she was asked what Num-  ber: she s'd the number of Devils: she complaynd: that: [Greens wife] _green_mary   & her [Aunt Carrier:] _carrier_martha  took her by the throat: & that they would not  lett her Confess. she s'd [Greens wife] _green_mary  had a pigg that use to follo  her: but after ward she Denyed all. & s'd: what she had s'd was in   hopes to have favour: & now she could not Deny god: that had keept  her from that sin: & after s'd though he slay me I will trust in him.(Reverse) Mar. Emerson Exam. title: SWP No. 049: Phillip English
content: SWP No. 49.5( [William Beale] _beale_william  v. [Phillip English] _english_phillip  )[August 8, 1692][William Beale] _beale_william  of Marbllee Head aged upward of Sixty yeares  testifieth & sayeth that last March past was twelve moenth towards  the latter end of the moenth then my self beeinge in the house of  [George Bonfeilds] _bonfields_george  of Marbllee Head whither I repaired that I mighte  have helpe to nurse or loake after mee because of A very greate  & wracking paine had seized uppon my body & the distemper of the  small pox then beeing in my house & my son [James] _beale_james  at the same time  then in my house lying sick then towards the latter end of that  moenth Aforesayed in that house as [as] I lay in my bed in the  morneinge presently after it was faiere lighte abroade in the roome  Where I lay in my bed which was layed low & neire unto the fire to-  wards the norward parte of the roome I beeing broade Awake I then  saw up on the south jaame of that Chimny A darke shade w'ch  covered the jaam of that chimney aforesayed from the under floore  to the upper floore & alsoe a dar[k] ness more then it was beefore  in the southerne part of the house & alsoe in the middlee of the dark-  ness in the shade uppon the jaame of the chimny aforesayed I bee-  held somethinge of the forme or shape of A man I tooke most notice  of his legs because they weere of a very greate stature or bigness I  wondred at the sighte & therefore I turned my head as I lay in my  bed & cast my eyes towards the south side of the house to see if the  sun weer risen or whether there weere any person or anythinge in  the house w'ch by the help of the sun mi[ght] cause such A shade  or shape but I saw non nor any lighte of the sun in that roome then  & then turned my head uppon the pillow where it was before I saw  in the darkness aforesayed the plaine shape or els the person of  [phillip English] _english_phillip  of Salem the w'ch reports say maried with [william hollingworths] _hollingworth_william  daughter of Salem ackcordinge to my best judgment  knoledg & understandeinge of him as I had formerly knoledg  & ackquaintance with him. my conjecktures of him & these passages  aforesayed were as followeth what is this mans business heere now I  remember not that ever I bought or should with him either more or  less or w'ch way came hee hither so soone this morneinge by land  or by water or hath hee been at marbllee Head all nighte & then  laboring to correct my [torn] not to thinke that hee was a wich;  & flyinge to Our omnipotent Jehovah for his blessing & protecktion  by secret ejaculations instantly the roome aforesayed became clear   & the shape shade or person vanished & this was about the time  that newes was brought to mee in the morneinge that my son [James] _beale_james   was very like to recover of the small pox w'ch I left at home sick:  & the same day in the after noone came news that hee was sud-  denly strooke with A paine on his sidde & did not expeck to live  three houres & ackCording to my judgment before three houres  weere ended newes came that hee was departed this life at w'ch  [docktor Jackson] _jackson_doc  w'ch was his docktor & [william dagget] _dagget_william  w'ch was  his narse both of marbllH'd told mee that they admired & wondred,  & it was not many moenths before that my son [George Beale] _beale_george  de-  parted this life in the same house & complained of A stoping in his  throate after he was Recovered of the small pox hee deceased janu-  ary the 23 before my son [James Beale] _beale_james  aforesayedeMarbllee head  August the 2CondAttetsed to this truth by  mee [*William Beale] _beale_william far this deponent testifieth that in the springe of the yeare be-  fore the new england forces went for cannady; [phillip english] _english_phillip  afore-  sayed came into A neighbors house where this deponent then was  present & then in A fauneing & flattering manner sayed to mee: you  are him w'ch can give mee A good evidence in shewing mee the  bounds of my lande; this deponant replyed & sayed I know not of  any you have; [phillip english] _english_phillip  replyed yes you doe & if you will Ile  pay you well I have a peice of eighte in my pocket for you & named  A peice of land by A certaine distance from my house w'ch I think  [Mr. Richard Reede] _reed_richard  of marblle[head] was then & is now in posses-  sion of it; this deponent replyed, doe not tell mee of your peice of  eight for if I bee called I must give evidence against you & told  him what I must say at w'ch hee seemed to bee moved & told mee  that I lyed.with more discourse aboute I so then wee departed; then  the next fa[ll] ensuing w'ch was about the time that the forces be-  gan to com from Cannady I then haveinge heard that [phillip english] _english_phillip   aforesayed had apprehensioned [Mr Reade] _reed_richard  aforesayed aboute the land afore-  sayed I then as I thought it my duty in concience adkquinted [Mr Reeds] _reed_richard  son with what I could say concerninge the titllee of the lande  aforesayed & withall told him of another witness as namely [Thomas farar sen'r] _farrer_thomas  of linn; then afterward upon their request I rode to lin  & at Lyn Mill there I found [Thomas farar] _farrer_thomas  Aforesayed & as wee  rode alonge lin Commons; then beetwixt the reverende [Mr Sheapards] _shepherd_rev  house & [Mr Leytons] _leyton_mr  then beeinge in discours aboute the titllee   of the lande aforesayed my nose gushed out bleedeinge in A most  extraordinary manner so that I bllodyed A hankershiff of an Con-  siderablle biggnes & allsoe ran downe uppon my cloaths & uppon  my horse mane. I lighted of my hors thinking the jodinge of horse  mighte cause it but it kept on Allthough not alltoger so bad till I  came to [Mr Reades] _reed_richard  at marbllee head & it hath blead not as I can  Remember never since I was a boy; exept about that time nor since  that time exept by ackcident that it was hurtthiese things that are set down last were before the former  evidence:[William Beale] _beale_william  owned the Above written before the Grand jury up-  on the Oath hee had taken in Court Jen'y 12th 1692 (Endorsed) [Beale] _beale_william  ag't. content: SWP No. 49.7([Susannah Sheldon] _sheldon_susannah  v. [Phillip English] _english_phillip  , [Sarah Buckley] _buckley_sarah  ,  and [Mary Witheridge] _witheridge_mary  )[++ May 17 1692 ]The complaint of [Susanna Shelden] _sheldon_susannah  against [phillip english] _english_mary  the s'd  [Susanah Shelden] _sheldon_susannah  being at meetting on the Sabboth day being the 24 of aprill shee beeing aflicted in a very sad manner she saw [phillip english] _english_phillip  step over his pew and pinshed her and a womand which came  from boston wich saith her name is [goodwy] when shee were com-  ing home against [william Shaws] _shaw_william  house their met her [phillip english] _english_phillip   and a black man with a hy crouned hatt on his head and a book in  hish hand houlding the book to her and [phillip english] _english_phillip
